Reviews.Author: DELAOSSA
Reviews.Content: A total of 11 partys of the same family booked this hotel for 3 day weekend to honor my brother at Los Encinos State Park ( The De La Ossa's ) Some of us had not seen each other 30 to 40 years, the hotel had nice patio areas for us to visit and were welcomed to continue visiting in the lobby past 10:pm . Also there parking lot was gated which was a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel poor location”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in June and thoroughly enjoyed our stay, particularly in the courtyard at night having a few drinks and conversing with fellow travellers. Car was nice and secure behind locked gates. Free continental breakfast. Staff polite and helpful, room quite large. Bad news was the location- no bars nearby only takeaways. Plenty of convenience stores mind though the miserable asian shopkeeper next door reminded me of the one in the movie â€˜Falling Downâ€™. Seemed a bit industrial with car repair shops abounding. My son felt ill at ease with the local groups of youths hanging around but I think the threat was more apparent than real. Long drive to anywhere-downtown LA and Santa Monica .Shame because obviously the hotel could not do anything about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: eltel43
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel via trip advisor, whilst looking for accomodation in Santa Monica. Due to the prices and being like Blackpool, we decided to move to LA which was going to be our next stop over. The hotel itself is on the main road but set back enough to avoid any traffic noise. The staff were excellent throughout, as were the rooms which had just been refurbished and were complete with all mod cons, a massive fridge, Telly, radio and a good strength free Wi Fi . ( No safe.) The bed which was also new, was as comfortable as any we had encountered on the trip. ( From San Fran to Phoenix. ) It also had a small pool that we did not use but we were out early and back late. Next to the pool is a nice courtyard area with tables and chairs.We could not remember seeing a lift on the premises but there may have been at the other end. Due to the block layout i.e large cube surrounding small cube, it has the potential to be noisey, as guests move along the corridors. We never experienced this and I suppose this type of layout is in the majority. The reception area is large and the lower end doubles as the breakfast area. Breakfast is also complimentary and there is a reasonable choice to kick start you in the morning. It doesn't have a bar but if you like a drink there is a Liquor store about 30 mts away to the one side and a pharmacy a similar distance the other way. We ate at the Firehouse , which is a Greek restaurant about a mile back towards the freeway and next to the park. The food was excellent and very reasonable, No Bar and you do have to pick up your tray from the counter but well worth a visit. Great owners. In all we really enjoyed our stay , staying a second night and marked it up as 8/10, which is good as CAESARS PALACE only got 9/10 due to it's pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: gvsuchic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend a week in Palm Desert and wanted to find a place to stay closer to LAX to fly home the next day. I Found this hotel online and my husband and I were very pleased! The rooms were clean, updated/remodeled, great free wireless connection, fridge and flat screen TV. I also have to mention the Staff was soo kind and made you feel at home! I was surprised when about a month later I got a call from the Hotel for a follow up Thank you for staying with them. Now that is good Hotel Management! I was so pleased to get the call, because that shows they truly care about there guest, So Thank you Reseda, Howard Johnson! I always use TripAdvisor whenever we go on vacation and when I saw all the great reviews for this Howard Johnson in Reseda, CA I booked it right away...I can always rely on TripAdvisor, and the reviews were true, it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and affordable”
Reviews.Author: yankee1313
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson in Resada CA was clean, comfortable, affordable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was a good value and saved $20-25 daily if we were to eat out. The hotel is located 1.5 miles from the LA Metro park and ride which provides efficient access to the city and Hollywood. There is also a CVS store next door. Good value and a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great to have Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Edsad
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in California in three cities. The Howard Johnson Reseda Inn & Suite was by far the better of the three hotels we stayed in. With our adult son traveling with us having a two room suite was fantastic. Both rooms had large flat screen televisions, phones and separate air conditioning. The bathroom was in his front room so there was no reason for him to disturb us. The room was clean, smoke free, and not too close to the ice machine. If the building had an elevator it would be perfect. And do not let the auto repair business in the neighborhood bother you. This is a really nice place, with very nice and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great service”
Reviews.Author: ThewKohl
Reviews.Content: Very helpful front desk. We had a group with 3 seperate rooms, they worked very hard to get us next to each other and upgraded our rooms to suites. Clean, comfortable rooms. Location was great for us with family near by, is a little drive to beaches, Hollywood and so forth, but not too far. Breakfast was a meager affair, but the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. The pool was smallish, but clean and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelingtrio42
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful and polite. Rooms very clean and roomy. If in area again will stay.

Reviews.Title: “good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: jonco
Reviews.Content: My wife, baby, and I stayed here for 4 nights May, and we were quite pleased. LA hotels are very expensive, and those on a budget should consider this place, which is fairly priced. The location is a bit out of the way, but you're less than 10 minutes from the freeway (either 101 or 405). The LA freeways are worse than ever, but if you avoid rush hour and accidents, you can be downtown or in West LA within a half an hour. (Get traffic reports on 1070AM). LAX was also about 35 minutes, and that was at rush hour (but traffic was moving then). The neighborhood is NOT dangerous; there is gated parking, but frankly, it isn't necessary. We mostly just parked out front and had no problem. I would walk around this neighorhood at night without any hesitation. By the way, another review said the apartment complex behind the hotel was run down. I disagree. Perhaps the reviewer was some sort of a millionaire and is used to mansions next door. The hotel is simply in one of the many parts of LA that aren't very charming (strip malls, etc.). Next to the hotel is a CVS, an auto repair shop, etc. There are some great ethnic restaurants in the neighborhood, including a great Mexican place on Vanowen, called Las Fuentes. The rooms in the front of the hotel get some street noise, and there's a fire station across the street, though we only heard a siren once in four days. We were close to the front, and the noise didn't bother us very much, but if you're sensitive, ask for a room back from the street. The hotel is very quiet inside, and we heard no noise at all from other guests. The breakfast is pretty minimal: two kinds of cold cereal, muffins, bread, juice, coffee. Many rooms have no microwave oven, but you can use the microwave in the lobby. We had a small refrigerator in our room. There is a small pool and jacuzzi, but they could be cleaned a bit more frequently. They're not heated. The rooms were spotless and recently renovated (granite counters in the bath, etc.). We had two Sharp Aquos flat-screen TVs in our suite. The hotel overall is in excellent shape. Our suite was a true one-bedroom, with a door you can close between the bedroom and the living room (unlike some "suites" we have seen). The housekeepers were very nice and responded instantly to requests for extra towels. The management and front desk people were very friendly and seemed to care a lot about our satisfaction. We definitely recommend this place, as long as you aren't hoping for a charming setting or a central location. Unless you're willing to spend a lot more, you can't expect everything, and frankly, this place is a very good deal for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: NR1Charlie
Reviews.Content: Hi, thanks for the great stay we had. and we are looking forward to spend our last night again at your hotel. Great staff. Thanks for storage. Charlie and Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GailAnnRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out very well for us. It is in a safe area away from freeway and road noise. It is less than 30 minutes from LAX, but there is no noise of planes taking off and landing. It was very convenient to all the activities in the area. There is a good pool and hot tub. Everything worked and was in very good coondition. The front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. We enjoyed this hotel. There is free wireless internet in the room. There is no elevator; so people who don't want to carry their suitcase up steps should request a first floor suite. We asked the front desk for restaurant recommendations and were told about 2 places close by. We went to the Top Thai restaurant and it was very good and they gave us a 10% discount. The food was excellent. If we had goone to Acapulco we could have gotten a 20% discount. The continental breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trotter2010_x
Reviews.Content: The staff was terrific, and provided excellent customer service. The hotel itself is pretty modest, but the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. An excellent bargain. I'd stay there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, close to Univ Northridge, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lamborghini_Countach
Reviews.Content: Our team stayed at the HoJo for the ASME Human Powered Vehicle competition and couldn't have picked a better hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Firendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Coops14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in April so we could visit Universal Studios. We did our homework before we booked this hotel and planned a route to Universal which only took us 20 mins. We had originally booked another hotel nearer to Universal, however after reading trip advisor we cancelled and booked this one, we are so glad we did. When we arrived we were greated very warmly and offerred complimentary cookies, they were delicious and fresh baked. We had booked three rooms for our family, one of the rooms was not quite ready so the manager upgraded us to a suite for no extra cost. We used the swimming pool, which was great to cool off and have a quick relax. We found the hotel to be very clean and all the rooms have a coffee maker, fridge and hairdryer, which all worked very well. There are many places to eat within walking distance and a CVS shop next door, very handy. We ate at Dennys which was a five minute walk. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, we had cereal, bagels & cream cheese and coffee and juice. We all slept very well here and would recomment this hotel. The hotel manager was very helpful in assisting with planning where to visit and how to get there etc. He is a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean stay”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H & J for two nights during the visit to LA. The staff is friendly and the room is clean and tidy. Free internet and breakfast. You may find the soundproof is not that great, since you could hear the steps from upstairs and talks from the lobby. However, we got no problem to fall in sleep after the busy sight-seeing in LA. There are a lots of restaurants around and one pharmacy beside it. The only thing I am not too sure is the area this hotel locates. It's really dark during the night (not too many lights on the street) and there is gate to the parking lot and hotel. Kind of scary. So make sure you don't go out alone during the night. All in all, we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: elforestero
Reviews.Content: Being from a rural area with a small population and little crime and pollution problems, I was apprehensive to be staying in LA for the first time in 7 years. As I drove through the neighborhood of the HOJO Reseda, I was relieved to find that it's not run down and the residents don't look scary. There are some closed storefronts, and it's certainly not upscale, but it just looked like an average LA neighborhood without any suspicous characters evident. Groups of schoolkids were walking home from school on the street the hotel is on and I didn't see anybody get shot or knifed. Whew! Though the neighborhood's ok, I was really surprised to see how nice the hotel looks from the outside in that it actually stands out as looking nicer than the neighborhood it's in. The desk staff was reasonably friendly. The parking was plentiful and seemed fairly secure in that it's gated all around, though not impenetrably so. The room was the biggest surprise. It was large, with all fixtures and furnishings looking new and clean. It looked good enough that I could actually see bringing a partner for a stay here if we were in the area and on a budget. Large flat-screen tv, working internet, fairly large fridge, desk, dresser, armchair, nighstands, fairly spacious bathroom, everything looked good. My room was away from the front of the building, and I wasn't bothered by the minor level of noise from the busy street out front. The infrequent noise of a helicopter overhead was a bit unnerving, and there was a little waiting in traffic to get up and down the street, but that's just LA. To feel I was in a fairly safe, clean, and pleasant environment here, about $85/night after taxes seemed like a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite part of town...”
Reviews.Author: BrownSuga07
Reviews.Content: We had just come from overseas. We needed a place to stay because we would be exploring LA for a couple of days. I poured over the reviews before making my decision. Let me get straight to the point: Parking: in the front basically on the street, in the back it looked a little ghetto-run down apartments over the fence Lobby: nice, the cookies were good, the attendant was nice, too Getting to our room: we went through an old looking door, the hallways were a little dark, not bright and modern like the lobby. Hubby said, "I've never been in a hotel that felt like a dungeon". LOL Even though I was tired, that was funny. Pool: Tiny/ if people are hanging out there, noisy Room: we were placed near the pool, I remember other reviews about loud noise and sure enough it was super noisy. Hubby went to ge us another room and the attendant graciously allowed it. After touring the city, we very tiredly went back to the room. It sounded like a large family was next door. They definitely had lots of children there. Again, it was very noisy. Hubby had to go over and ask them to quiet down. Better him than me! He's much nicer. That morning, the children/family was noisy, but we were on our way out. No microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, iron. Breakfast: Your regular dry fare-milk, juice, toast, cereal, fruit, pastry-it was ok. I would not go back. I hate hearing noises through the wall that loud. No privacy. I will reccommend it just because it was not overly expensive. I think if you plan and research you can find cheaper hotels closer to the city which was our purpose for being there. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lousy location”
Reviews.Author: EdsMumandDad
Reviews.Content: Somehow I was under the impression that this was close to Universal Studios in North Hollywood - but it is miles from anywhere. However it is clean and comfortable with really big rooms and very nice staff. The Thai restaurant 5 minutes walk away is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little motel in a rather shabby part of th suburb”
Reviews.Author: koreconsult
Reviews.Content: The motel is located in Reseda Blvd in a rather run down strip mall area. However, the motel is well maintained, has good security, adequate off street parking; and the rooms are clean and of adequate size. The motel is easy to find from LAX. Just take 405 onto 101 and then right onto Reseda Blvd, and is handy to Hollywood, Santa Monica and the Getty Center. The motel is excellent value for the price, which includes a continental breakfast, free local phone calls, and free wireless internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for north L.A.”
Reviews.Author: RiceyHalifaxEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked for 7 nights but only stayed for 5. No fault of the hotel though, we had a three day ticket for Disneyland and hadn't realised it was a 100 mile round trip on traffic clogged freeways! (Do your research first) The rooms are large with two comfy queen beds and are kept very clean. Everything is provided. A bonus is the free continental breakfast, cereal, coffee, tea, begals and toast, the free car parking and the free wireless internet are welcome extras The staff are really helpful, especially Chris, who couldn't do enough to guide us wherever we wanted to go. The hotel is very handy for north L.A. and Univirsal Studios. If you want to do the Hollywood bit then buy a Hollywood City pass online and save loads. If you are travelling by car to Hollywood then parking couldn't be easier. The Kodak Theatre is actually part of a massive shopping complex which comprises the Rennaisance Hotel and next door a huge underground car park which, providing you have your ticket validated (stamped) at the information desk in the Hollywood Blvd foyer will cost $2 for the first 4 hours up to $10 dollars max. The Rennaisance is on Highland and the Kodak Theatre is on Hollywood Blvd, so if you find the intersection of the two, then travel uphill (north) towards the church for 100yards before turning left into the car park entrance. Eating around HoJo is easy but apart from Chilis it seems to be all fast food. The staff, however will guide you in this, even to the extent of giving you discount vouchers. In summary then: read the title!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: duece2
Reviews.Content: We came up to stay for the rose bowl and stayed at the howard johnson in reseda. The rooms where large and very clean. They took such great care of us while we were california. I would highly recommend they for any one traveling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great price, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: travelthewold123
Reviews.Content: The staff here was definitely amazing. The entire hotel is recently renovated and under new management. We had a quiet room next to the pool and were not disturbed at all throughout the night. The maids and maintenance crew were also very polite. We will definitely be back to Hojo Reseda.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiHatti
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Van Nuys twice a year for the last 5 years always searching for an economical clean place to stay. Well we found it and what more can I say but a great place especially if your watching your expenses. The staff was courteous, rooms were very clean, and a better than most continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, free warm cookies in the evening, quiet”
Reviews.Author: dfitzpatrick11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a sleeper. It is luxurious enough that it makes you feel at home. Under new management for a year and wiht remodeled rooms it rivaled to my favority Hampton Inn & Suite rooms. I had an inner room next to the fountain in the courtyard and it was dead quite despite being on busy road. Soft beds!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ATJLancsUK
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing you could say about this motel was that the views were not great. That said everything else was amazing value for money. The rooms had been recently refurbished, the bathroom had a powerful shower and it was unexpectedly quiet. We enjoyed the inclusive breakfast and the service was exceptional. We had a problem with our netbook and Chris on reception made several phone calls and we ended up taking it to Frys Electronics (a fantastic store) who fixed it in 30 minutes for free! Well done Chris at Hojo and William at Frys - they were both magnificent. We spent 6 days of pure enjoyment at Hojo Resada and touring LA.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to CSUN and everything else!”
Reviews.Author: TravelA2Z
Reviews.Content: Great welcome & service from front desk. Completely remodeled rooms. Love the location.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - you get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Berrnie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on TA, but for the 1st time ever, thought the reviews didn't match our experience. The location of this hotel was a fair way from anything, situated in the middle of surburbia. If you haven't got your own car, forget it! We made sure when we left each day, we wouldn't have to return for anything until late at night - it was just too out of the way. The rooms have been recently renovated and are well appointed and clean, but that's where the good news ends. Cheap disposable cups for coffee & water, and towels that are so thin and small, they would hardly dry a small child! Worst of all is the noise. There seems to be no insulation whatsoever between rooms. I heard every thump of the bedhead adjoining our room one night, and every footstep of the insomniac above us the next. Add to this the constant bang of the gate at the back door, and the noise of concrete walkways everywhere - sleep was just about impossible. I didn't see any point in trying to move, as I think it would be the same everywhere. Thank goodness it was too cold for the pool to be in use! The breakfast provided was most basic (fruit looked about 4 weeks old), and all served on cheap disposable tableware. Arrived 1st morning at 9.25 as it was being packed away, and we certainly didn't feel welcome to even grab anything to take back to our room. It would have been helpful to be told at check-in that breakfast finished at 9.30! We did notice a sign later, but you would never see it checking in! This is a budget hotel - and if you don't value your sleep, I guess its ok. We have stayed at many other budget hotels (always using TA as a reference), but we were disappointed with this one. We'lll be considering all reviews a little more carefully in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: haf2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights while sightseeing around LA. I will definitely stay here again! I'm not one to pay hundreds of dollars per night for high end fancy hotels, when i'm only using the bed and shower, so this hotel was perfect! The staff was amazing..from the front desk crew to the housekeeping. The one small negative thing that I noticed, which is really no big deal at all, is the bathroom light and fan are on the same switch...so if you just want the light on for extra lighting in the room, you have to listen to the drone of the fan as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrsmas
Reviews.Content: The location was good for us, since we were visiting a grandparent in the area. The room was clean. Nice 32" tv. Renovation paid off. Pros: clean room, breakfast included, plenty of hot water, good price, gated parking, free internet. Cons: noisy hallway, not enough towels in room, bagel toaster was broken on one side, creating an inconvenience if more than one person wanted a bagel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clark40
Reviews.Content: A Perfect hotel for the business traveler and located in an ideal central area accessible from anywhere in the city any hour . Overall set up is excellent and counter staff courteous and helpful. so much so that at times you feel you are unnecessarily taking advantage of their nature just because you want to experience the Royal feeling which the staff wants you to experience. The room linen were clean & it had all amenities . It was a perfect stay .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: equipo_a
Reviews.Content: Our son just moved into the area and selected HOJO due to its proximity to his new house. The staff and front desk were professional and courteous. Everyone, including maids and groundskeepers were happy and helpful. Our room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. We will stay here again when we come back to visit my son and his family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: taj33rpm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Howard Johnson Reseda for five days while visiting friends and sightseeing in LA. I found the staff very helpful and friendly, offering me printed directions to LA sights. Hotel parking is gated access and easy to use with your room cardkey. My room was clean and comfortable; I especially liked the large flat panel TV and bathroom which appeared to have been recently renovated. The only drawback is the noise; I could often hear the voices of other tennants outside my door in the pool/hot tub area and also people walking on the floor above. Not so bad in January, but I can see how the noise might become annoying during warmer months with more activity around the pool area. Overall this hotel is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Reseda as base for exploring Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: MatkaajaSuomi
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in the west with my family and stayed 4 nights in Reseda. The location of the hotel was good even though the surrounding was not that great. The overall impression was good and the room could fit our 5 person family. When reading the room descriptions on the Internet it was not obvious if there would be 5 beds in the room or not. It turned out that they could provide a roller bed (with an extra cost that was not mentoined in the reservation) that we managed to squeeze in. For some reason we had to ask for towels each evening as we were always provided with only 2. But in summary we found the stay OK when considering the cost for the room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best budget hotels I know”
Reviews.Author: lw12345
Reviews.Content: I spent two days in the hotel with my wife and little daughter. The rooms are nice and clean, the personnel is very friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast is better than one would expect considering the price. Wireless internet services are complimentary. I would definitely recommend it to anybody who is looking for a hotel around L.A. in an affordable price range.

Reviews.Title: “Perfefct hotel for an almost perfect Rose Bowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Motherof4PaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Other than the outcome of the football game (University of Oregon lost!) our Rose Bowl weekend was perfect. This Howard Johnsons was clean, comfortable, affordable and centrally located to all that we wanted to do. The staff was courteous and helpful when helping us find a left behind item after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0nda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Reseda on a emergency medical trip for my daughter. I call the hotel and received a very compassionate response from Andy Vanmali, the manager. The hotel has been remodeled and it is very nice looking. The room was really great and the bath room was very clean. We will be staying at this hotel the next time we are in the area. We felt safe at this hotel. Nice area, close to restaurants, shopping and hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY AT VERY AFFORDABLE RATES”
Reviews.Author: DanburyGal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from visiting with family in the LA area and stayed here twice, once at the beginning of my trip for 3 nights and again for the last night before heading home to CT. They are very friendly, courteous and professional. The rooms are very clean, have small refrigerators and large flat screen tv's. Wireless internet service and continental breakfast are included. You can park behind a locked gate, and there is a CVS within walking distance. I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived there. I highly recommend them for their service, cleanliness, really reasonable rates, and the very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful,pleasant stay i have ever had !! thank you”
Reviews.Author: saidenough
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms,clean,new rooms you must stay here when you are in los angeles,california.. the staff is friendly,professional ,excellent group of workers !!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean rooms excellent”
Reviews.Author: ian4sueSydney
Reviews.Content: Arrived earlier than check in time, reception staff very helpful when we asked if we could leave our luggage, they checked if our rooms were ready and as they were we were checked in about 4hrs early, which meant we did not have to go sight seeing with all our luggage in the car. Rooms were fresh and clean all ameneties were great, would stay again when visiting the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: MMSA2123
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on-line when looking for a good deal on a room. The staff at the hotel was exceptionally friendly and courteous. The room was very nice and the grounds were well kept. For the price it had good room features such as a mini fridge and flat screen t.v.. I very much enjoyed my quick stay there and don't have anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best Rooms For A Great Economical Price. Plus Friendly Service.”
Reviews.Author: u156812
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how well the rooms are kept and maintained. These rooms in my opinion are better then some rooms i have seen in Las Vegas. I give them straight 10's across the board. If your looking for a very nice spacious room for a great deal, then i recommend Howard Johnson in Reseda.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mouszarrad
Reviews.Content: During the visit, We enjoyed a very comfortable rooms and residence as well as breakfast As well as good treatment of workers

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JBHolland
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Staff was very friendly. The parking is behind a fence, so that is nice too. Rooms are clean, modern. Close by with a car are some drive through and a 7 eleven.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a cheap nice hotel and you donÂ´t mind driving a bit more when in LA”
Reviews.Author: Arkaini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a couple nights since it was affordable for LA prices and well-rated in Tripadv. The service was excellent and our experience was overall good,despite some problems with noise what were fixed (by changing us to another room twice) by the staff of the hotel. We paid 176$ for 2 nights. The first thing is that this hotel is only relatively close to LA. We drove 30min in average on our way back to the hotel from several places in LA (downtown, Sta Monica), which for us was convenient for the money we saved. The only problem we had is that the first night the nose coming from the AC upstairs would make impossible to sleep. We were moved to another room immediately upon request and again the same morning (we wanted a king bed, plus in the second room we could hear footsteps the whole night). There is a nice hot tub and the breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good. Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I didn't expect much from this hotel. But when I saw that their manager answers to all comments on TripAdvisor, I was convinced that it will be OK. I was so surprised! The hotel was clean, staff were ALWAYS friendly and breakfast was absolutely outstanding! We parked our car behind the hotel, in fenced area, which was also great. There is a grocery store besides the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelinlife4me
Reviews.Content: Recently updated rooms. Very spacious and clean with brand new flat screen TV. Courteous staff and good, simple breakfast. Located in an urban, residential area and the hotel offers secure parking with gated access. Some local and chain restaurants a couple of miles up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best of region”
Reviews.Author: Biribas
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and we're suprised with the confort and cleanliness of the room. The employees are very cordial and attentive. The breakfast is very good. Free internet on room! Worth every dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TAS20
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to California we stayed in a number of accommodations and were quite happy with this one. The staff were very courteous during check in and offering change for vending machines when needed and we were very happy with our 2 queen standard room which was spacious and clean. The air con unit was great as it was temperature controlled so the room was always a comfortable temperature. The wifi worked great. The breakfast was great - enough for us to start our day. As we had planned a trip to Universal Studios and a trip to Six Flags the location was great (if you've got a car) as it was only about 30 minutes to each. We also travelled into Santa Monica which wasn't too far away. As we were leaving, we discovered our rental car had a flat tire and the Management were very helpful - thank you for that. We got a really good deal here - very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel from a frequent Guest”
Reviews.Author: ames79
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent hotel guest. I have been staying at the hotel weekly Since March 2009- to present Monday thru Friday. The Hotel service is awsome always accommodating to my needs and requests. The location is perfect for me -close to my job-site. Free parking is always a plus and I always get my same room which is in view of my Truck. My stay is always hassle free and relaxing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “You make the call. You can ask the room next door, they'll hear you...”
Reviews.Author: HareWeGo
Reviews.Content: This was one of four stops on our California tour. Like many, I booked this location because of reviews here and that Reseda was a family stop over before our next stop, (Yosemite). The jury is out on this one. Unlike other reviews, you judge for yourself. We had a late check-in, (like 3 am) because of flight delaysâ€™. Even though I called five hours earlier to notify them of my status, they no longer held my credit card reserved NON-smoking 2Q room. Instead my family received a 2Q â€œmust have just had smokersâ€� room. Itâ€™s amazing how easy you can tell the different between a non-smoking and a smoking room. Thereâ€™s just nothing thatâ€™s going to take the smell out. Lucky, this was just a two night stay. Quiet place; so quiet that when my family checked-in at 3am and just started to settle down a 3 and 6 year old on jetlag, it was enough to spawn a call from the front desk within 5 minutes of us being in our room for making to much noise. I think it was the toilet flushing that did us in. I have never been call on before for noise. So assume very thin walls. Continue and you'll see. Room had up to date furnishings including a HDTV. Channel selection is all over the spectrum. Some channels worked and others didn't. (Not sure to blame hotel or Cable company). The location has a courtyard style pool / lounge area. Small but nice design since it keeps the views of the surrounding auto body shops out of range. Location has wireless except it was not accessible from our room. Probably out of range or the signal was overwhelmed by all the other local auto body shop businesses wireless connections. Location: Reseda is big, so all locations in Reseda are NOT the same. We witness that coming down Reseda Blvd. from the 405, (approx 2mi). Went from a upper class nice looking shops to a blue-collar mix class, mechanist industry location. Your parking and entrance ways are both gated by access cards. The jury here comes back deadlocked. If the reservation was kept as a non-smoking room and it didnâ€™t warrant a call from the front desk, (who obviously knew we just checked in), I would better rate the place. However, things like this just donâ€™t go well, especially after a long travel day. Also, consider the location if your traveling with families. Not much within the surrounding area. Not a great night life. Now about the thin walls. Our second night we were awaken around 2 am by a couple who obviously was having a much better start to their vacation then ours.... :) Next review stop: Best Western, Sonora, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Calfoodie
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this hotel i took a risk. The location is not much to be desired considering, just left The Venetian in LV. Yes, lower income neighborhood but never judge people by their income! The remodeled rooms was the seller for me. It's in the San Fernando Valley not to far from LA attractions. Loved everything about the room. Great bed, flat screen tv, fridge, free wireless hook-up-did not use. And to save money cont. brkf. The area restuarants were excellent all the food was great. They have a pool and jacuzzi-small mind you. The only down side is that if you get in early like before check-in you will pay a fee if you want your room. Just left LV and early check-in was no problem. But all and all a wonderful experience. Oh and by the way a drugstore is next door and freeways are near. Give it a chance if you don't mind a residental neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but too far out of L.A for us”
Reviews.Author: ccjsw
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and spacious room enough for the five of us. We had our own bedroom which had all been newly decorated and the kids were on a sofa bed and rollaway .The location was just not right for us though. The traffic was always really heavy so it took an hours stressful driving to get into central LA .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: GilbertoAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We agreed fully with other reviews: a good hotel for a fair price. All locations (Santa Monica, Malibu, Hollywood) we wanted to visit were not too far. The rooms were spacious, clean and had good beds. One detail: the breakfast was a bit boring.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dudeVancouver
Reviews.Content: We were in Santa Ana for other business prior to heading closer to Six Flags Ca for the end of our trip. We could have found something closer to the amusement park but nothing this inexpensive was available last minute so we took a chance with the Reseda HoJo. Far better than we expected. The staff was incredibly friendly and there was a decent continental breakfast and free wireless internet provided. There was even a very well run and clean public laundry facility 1/2 block away for us to refresh our by then well travelled waredrobes...

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to stay but some problems”
Reviews.Author: ovalface
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews here on Tripadvisor prompted me to book our stay at the said hotel. Upon arrival, I notice that the room was clean, which was very important to me as I am the "Monk" of all "Monks" (For those who don't know, Monk is a tv character who has an OCD and a clean freak) and spacious. I like the granite countertop and bath wall, So I have to give them 5 stars on that area. The complimentary breakfast is really filling, not just the regular sweet pastries. Although they offer that but that's just one of the many they have. From cereal, fruits but no banana, my favorite fruit which I think they should add, to bagels, toast, juices, milk and coffee. Just an advice, I think they should offer a fat free milk in addition to the regular milk they have and maybe decaf too to those who are coffee drinkers. Here I'll give them 4 maybe next time I'll give them a 5 if they heed to my suggestion of offering fat free milk, decaf, and some banana which I think echoed the sentiment of others who had stayed here. About the service, they are very friendly and helpful especially the guy who checked us in, I don't remember the name, but I'll have to edit this later once I found out from my spouse. But there was one guy named Bobby who was not sympathetic at all to our problem. He is one of the problems we have encountered. The other problem which Bobby wasn't sympathetic at all was our daily visit to the Reception area to have our cards magnetized. Every night when we came back to enter the hotel parking area, the machine slot wouldn't take our card that the hotel provided, it wouldn't open the gate. That was a nuisance as we have to climb down the car to have it magnetized so we can enter. Also, whenever we leave our hotel room to take a dip in the pool or eat breakfast, we couldn't enter anymore even how many times we slippe the card into the door slot, it just wouldn't open. So when we told Bobby about the problem during our second night, he didn't show any reaction at all, he seemed to be stoic about it. He was also the same guy who had it magnetized our card on our first night there. Another problem we had was we came to our room unmade, we were expecting the room made up. Outside the door of the room, I knew something was not right as I saw a "Don't Disturb" sign hanging on the knob. When I left that morning there was nothing there as I even made sure that the door was locked by moving the knob. I don't know how it got there but I expected a clean room upon my return. But over all, the stay was great, from the room to the food to the people there except the guy mentioned. I hope the management will take heed on the issues/ concerns/ suggestions we had. I will surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected,”
Reviews.Author: 48nascarfan
Reviews.Content: our room was cozy and well furnushed, Even flat screen TV ,frount desk was very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean rooms let down by noise from pool”
Reviews.Author: BlackIslers
Reviews.Content: I thought the room we stayed in was nice and clean. The staff were helpful but we were badly let down by noise from the pool outside their own advertised usage times - slamming access gates and noise from kids within feet of the room window. I had to complain 3 times (once for each night we stayed) and nothing was done to resolve this. However, the manager was good to talk to and stressed that he would take steps to improve the situation in future and that staff were fully instructed to deal with these issues. I understand the hotel is under new management and is much better than in the past. Certainly the place was very clean - all the rooms had been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraV47
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the renovation done to the hotel. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Continental breakfsast was fresh and tasty and the staff was most accomodating. The location was very convenient. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay, but don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: tobHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We had a fine stay, nothing to complain about. Staff is friendly and things worked. Anyhow, the main asset of this hotel are low prices â€“ itâ€™s good value for money. Don't expect anything more than a basic motel, there is nothing fancy about this place. After all the great reviews on tripadvisor for this place I expected probably a bit too much. Knowing that, I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place for a stay in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: poultrip
Reviews.Content: A fine place for a stay in Los Angeles. Reasonable price. Friendly staff. The romm big and clean and secured parking. I will recommend this hotel as a good place when visiting the interesting things in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: achma
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean big rooms, good breakfast and a nice pool for the kids. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, that's the least I expected on LA”
Reviews.Author: iSSergio
Reviews.Content: After the first wrong-election of a motel on LA we were lucky to find HJ Inn & Suites ! This time we found a nice location, not-so-bad communicated, with a big and decent room, great complimentary breakfast (including fresh fruit, which is quite important), also great complimentary internet connection and, the best of all, excellent service ! Our plus was an angel called Christine (not sure about the spell, but I could draw her on a paper) who not only solved our questions regarding the hotel, but helped us with useful information for our three-days trip on LA. Maybe the only drawback was that there was a fire station in front of us, and it seems LA city requires their services quite often...but if you are the kind of person that has a heavy sleep you won't regret this election for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!”
Reviews.Author: kittenlover72
Reviews.Content: Very good location, quiet and very nice and clean rooms. Price very good fr the quality...Thanks a lot, it was a great stay....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, frIendly, clean and well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: uvamom13
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week with my teenage daughter. We were concerned being to females staying across country, the staff was nice, the rooms were spacious and clean. It is a great deal. I would gladly stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: maeliz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there previously and is very convenient stay to go to six flags magic mountain and universal studios. Rooms are roomy and it right next to cvs if you forgot anything.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Gil34
Reviews.Content: Great place very recommended . serch 2 weeks to find hotel - very good place. do not hesitate to write me for any question. just 20-30 min to central L.A

Reviews.Title: “awful experience”
Reviews.Author: mojita2
Reviews.Content: Nice looking rooms but a porno movie was shot in the room right upstairs from me. Besides the noise from above there was the "crew" that shouted all night and slammed doors until around 5am. When I asked about it at the front desk they were aware a crew was there doing "interviews"...yeah, riiight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Katrina12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Howard Johnson inn for 3 nights and were impressed by the helpful staff - especially the weekend manager. He went out of his way to find us a book about things to do while staying in Los Angeles and was very happy to help us with any questions. The location was fine and was easy to get to the main attractions like Universal Studios, Hollywood walk of fame etc. The room was generally clean, nice flat screen t.v and comfy bed. Our rental car was nice and secure behind a security gate. The only negative aspects to the room was a slight sticky patch on the carpet and we had a little trouble with the room cards, which was quickly sorted out. The Howard Johnson inn is excellent value!! If we return to Los Angeles we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This 2-star hotel is much better than some 3.5-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravel9
Reviews.Content: I am writing from The Bevery Garland Holiday Inn* in North Hollywood, this supposedly 3.5-star hotel is not even half as good as the Howard Johnson Reseda. I like almost everything about this hotel except for two things... 1. Location: If you don't drive, you really don't want to stay here - and I am good at taking LA's public buses, no grocery store or fast food restaurant within walking distance - unless you don't mind walking 30 minutes or longer. (There are two Vietnamese restaurants a few minutes walk from the hotel, I tried one of them, their cooking was mediocre at best. 2, Cigarette Smoke: Although I stayed in a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor, I could smell cigarette smoke very often, even putting a thick towel under the door did not help. *WARNING! Although I booked a 3.5-star hotel at hotwire (May 24-28), they gave me a 3-star Holiday Inn and hotwire won't offer any refund or compensation, instead, to rub salt to injury, they sent me a link to their website that clearly shows Holiday Inn is a 3-star hotel... Our 3-star hotels include:Holiday Inn, Radisson, DoubleTree... http://www.hotwire.com/pop-up/hotel-ratings-popup.jsp

Reviews.Title: “Wana save money and live in style :)”
Reviews.Author: humrahi
Reviews.Content: Very good for your money,affordable, convienent for shopping. Staff at the hotel were very friendly. Rooms were very clean and tidy. You can not go wrong for the money your paying. I would stay here and drive to north hollywood and disneyland because you can save money on your rooms and spend it on your vacation. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: theNetherlandsAnna
Reviews.Content: During our trip to America we spent 2 nights at the Howard Johnson Inn Reseda. Satisfied customers on tripadvisor advised to book a room in this hotel, and I must admit, it really is a good hotel! We had a nice large room, very clean, a beautiful bathroom, probably just renovated, and each morning a good breakfast. The staff was very helpful and friendly and did everything to make our stay a pleasant one. Although it isn't close to the major attractions in L.A. (about half an hour drive) it is worth booking, especially considering the price! A small detail: we read on Tripadvisor that there is a parking especially for guests. We weren't told of this possibility upon check-in, and left our car in front of the entrance in a small parking close to the road. Although nothing happened (it seems to be a safe neighbourhood) we would have appreciated it leaving our rental car in a safe parking. But: when returning to this area we will definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lessfun
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money. Convenient, friendly, comfortable. I would definitely stay at this hotel next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwigalNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The staff here were fabulous, very helpful. We made use of their local knowledge, in particular using the bus system (right outside the hotel) to get around to local attractions. They were also able to tell us were food was close by and fill us in on things to do and how to get cheap transport to the airport etc. While were we staying it reached about 100degrees and the air conditioning the room was a godsent. The pool was cold, but perfect for the weather, although towards the end of our stay a few bugs could have been cleaned on the pool. The Spa pool was very warm. The breakfast that was provided each morning was great, with muffins, bagels cereal and toast as well as an assortment of fruit and drinks. The staff made this place really special, from printing out bus routes to charging our walkmans. They were always willing to go the extra mile. This hotel is not close to major tourist areas (universal studios, Hollywood etc, but the savings we made by staying outside of the tourist zone, and the fun of touring the city via the bus system was completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Business.”
Reviews.Author: powak
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel because it was the closest hotel to CSU Northridge where we were attending an orientation for a study abroad program. The hotel is very nice! Beautiful rooms, pool and sitting area by a fountain. What ruined the experience was even though I paid with cash, I was told they needed my credit card as well and they ran a slip which I had to sign authorizing them to charge me for any damage I may do to their room. Upon check out, they will inspect your room and determine if you get the credit card slip that you signed with out any charges! A man checked in after me and he was very upset by this as was I. When I checked out in the morning, they gave me back the slip I had signed with out looking at my room but I was very upset by the whole process. I always leave my rooms so clean and nice because I used to clean hotel rooms myself and know what hard work it is and how ungrateful people can be about it. I always leave a tip for the room cleaner. I am ashamed to say I did not do so this time, I had to wonder if the managers go in the rooms to look at them and then take any money left for the one who cleans the room. I also had a hard time getting my room card to open the gate for parking and my room. Other than those two things this was a nice hotel and close to the college.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel staff & a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sugarbear1_4
Reviews.Content: This the best hotel I have stayed in a long time. The staff is great, the rooms are clean and the breakfast is yummy. Also the pool is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “not for wheelchair user”
Reviews.Author: ranju37
Reviews.Content: i stayed in disable room which looked lovely but didnt give me freedom the bed was kingsize but too high for wheelchair trainsfer the toilet had grab rail on left but none on the right of the toilet. the shower seat didnt have two grab rails the toilet was too low for transfer without help the room was not cleaned one day out of the 11 days we stayed. we looked for another hotel next day but the other hotel's disable rooms were even worse. the hotel would be very good value for able persons there was lot of noise from upstairs rooms

Reviews.Title: “Sirens blaring all the time”
Reviews.Author: local2tracy
Reviews.Content: General Impressions: Stayed here the day before we went to San Diego, we drove from Northern California. We also planned to stay again after San Diego prior to going back to N. Cal. I ended up cancelling the other reservation the night after our first stay. Instead moved to the Hampton Inn in Van Nuys (where we enjoyed our stay). Would not recommend for families with young children. The hotel/motel itself is average but in a noisy/scary area, offers so-so breakfast. Customer service is not as welcoming as I'm accustomed to. Better people-skills needed and they need to re-stock their first-aid kit. My husband wanted an advil/tylenol and the front-desk told us to buy from the nearby CVS pharm. Our Room: When we arrived at the non-smoking room, it smelled strongly of cleaning solution. Other than that, the room was clean. We were in the "Presidential 2-room 2 Queen suite" and it was a big disappointment since I expected 2 bedrooms and 2 Queen beds. The other Queen was a pull-out sofa bed in the receiving area. There is only 1 bedroom with a Queen bed in it. I think the way they advertised the room is deceptive. The sofa bed also had sheets on but folded-in so I don't know whether the cleaning person didn't change the sheets. This is the first time I encountered this since most hotel sofa-beds don't have the sheets on - you have to get the fresh sheets from the closet and put it on yourself. Parking : Gated parking where you use your guest room card to open (one of our cards did not work though), I noted the scary signs posted regarding "No drugs (etc) allowed on the premises" mentioned by another reviewer. Our car was fine, though and I didn't notice anyone loitering. Food : There's a couple of restaurants in short driving distance - but didn't try them. You can also get menu of restaurants that deliver to the hotel from the hotel lobby, we tried the Chinese place and the food was OK for the price. However, the delivery person knocked on our door - which surprised me - I expected the front-desk to call me first when the food delivery arrived. I do not think this was safe. Noise : Sirens blaring all the time (I counted 7 from 8pm to 12 midnight) - don't know if it was the police or the ambulance. The rooms were not sufficiently insulated. However, our room was close to the parking lot gate on the right-hand side. It may be quieter for the rooms at the back of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, a bit far from main attrcations”
Reviews.Author: shnel
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms for a good price. Have to go through a lot of traffic in order to get to main attractions

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for visiting the Nothern LA attractions”
Reviews.Author: dl2hbx
Reviews.Content: Pro: Remodeled rooms Large rooms Decent rate Internet Fridge Good location to Universal Studios Con: No microwave The hotel was a good place to stay and we spent three nights of our road trip there in order to visit the Universal Studios. Breakfast could have been a bit better (more choices, sufficient quantities) but it was ok for a start. A microwave in the room would have been nice, but other than that, we were pretty happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: hhba
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be clean, well lit, beautifully decorated, and with an excellent staff that understands the meaning of customer service. My room was spacious and I loved the flat screen T.V. The breakfast bar was excellent and well stocked. I had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Miki2009
Reviews.Content: Room - clean, good space, looked remolded, plasma TV (nice surprise) Location - far from main attractions, but not an issue as we realized that LA is a city for car drive. Also, it was easy to take US101 Fwy. Parking - private and secure Others - free wireless internet. CVS pharmacy next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the drive, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Awaala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HoJo in Reseda while visiting LA Colleges for my son. The rooms were clean, updated and very comfortable. We did not plan on spending a lot of time in our room as we were on school tours during part of the day and then took advantage of being outside in the wonderful California sunshine. When we did make it back to the hotel, we had a clean comfortable room to watch TV and sleep. Having the daily breakfast was a great way to start the day, without having to take time out to go to a reastaurant. Breakfast inlcuded a a variety of cold cereals, toast, muffins, bagels, juice and coffee. Driving to the hotel from Highway 101 is scenic in its own way. Not being from the area all I can provide is my impression which is it looks like a working class area that is 'worn around' the edges. The CVS next store was very handy and the Denny's up the street was good when we went out to breakfast one morning. If you are looking for somewhere for dinner nearby I would suggest going on Ventura Blvd, which is just south of the Reseda exit off of 101. We discovered that there was a number of restaurants and stores on Ventura Blvd that we would have liked to check out but this was on the last night before we headed back home.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Quiet. What more could you ask?”
Reviews.Author: jackrabbitslims
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews on this site are pretty accurate. I found the hotel to be a pleasant place to stay. It was very clean, the staff was helpful and courteous, and there were no noise or problems with the people staying in the hotel itself. (There were two groups of college students there during our stay and we expected the worst. Never happened.) Free parking with a gated lot was a nice addition, even if it did take a few swipes of our hotel key to get the thing to work at times. The room itself was a nice size and was always kept tidy by housekeeping. And the free continental breakfast was a nice touch. You're going to be about 20-30 minutes away from Hollywood if you stay here, so you'll have to do some driving, but we found that that was a minor trade-off for the inexpensive room, free parking and free breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: InfliteNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: This is a fully refurbished hotel. The room was great: the airconditioning unit was pleasantly quiet and there was a flat screen TV on the wall! The staff was very pleasant and attentive. The breakfast choices were very satisfying . For our purposes the location was perfect. We were completely satisfied with all phases of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great to family”
Reviews.Author: AnnaSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: excellent rooms for families, close to Los Angeles. We reserve a suite with 2 rooms and are very well accomodated! The breakfast also was good what it helped sufficiently. I very recommend the hotel, mainly during the weekends when it has little traffic in the highways

Reviews.Title: “Good,Clean Stay”
Reviews.Author: sathyusa
Reviews.Content: Hi i stayed from dec 19 to 22.first i was confused to choose reseda area as its 20 to 30 min from holllywood.but luckily i choosed it . the room and bathroom was clean,neat and big enough.the reseda area is safe and has got supermarket,restaurant near by.everymorning the breakfast is served from 6:30 to 9:30 , is also good.overall i had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For The Price”
Reviews.Author: VistaBigBoy
Reviews.Content: Total shock on first visit, this is an older facility that has been totally remodeled to modern standards. The rooms are spacious and the warm colors give a real homey feeling. The rooms underwent 100% rennovation with all new plumbing fixtures, countertops, doors, carpet etc. The flat screen wall mounted t.v adds a nice finishing touch for today's decor. I have been staying here for the last month 3-4 days a week and will be staying here for at least the next two months. I highly recommend this place and it is comparable to any $125,00-$150.00 room elsewhere. You are only 20-25 minutes from downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great service, new renovated rooms, best inexpensive hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: HotelWizerd
Reviews.Content: Wow, amazing hotel, great service, great wifi, great everything. My room with a jacuzzi was newly renovated for only $110 a night, plus the a/c unit didnt make any noise while i was sleeping. The granite was enticing, and i loved everything. Best inexpensive hotel ive stayed at yet.

Reviews.Title: “You simply won't find a better value in the Los Angeles area”
Reviews.Author: lewzealand
Reviews.Content: All of the positive things written in the reviews below are entirely accurate. The room we stayed in was painted in warm peaceful earth tones that complemented the modern furnishings. The place itself clean, quiet and secure and we enjoyed the free wi-fi and flat panel television. The secured parking (your hotel key grants you access to a gated lot in the rear of the property) was an added bonus and certainly gave us piece of mind. The staff was every bit as friendly and informative as noted in the other reviews. Location: Reseda isn't the worst area, but it's not the best either. (SUV driving suburbanites probably wouldn't feel safe walking the neighborhood after dark.) All the same, it's conveniently located between the Ventura/101 freeway to the south and 405 to the east, about four miles or so from each. Hollywood, beaches, Universal Studios, all within a half-hour drive or so (depending upon traffic). Food and sundries: The complimentary continental breakfast was simple yet satisfying: oatmeal, muffins, danishes, bagels, cereal, juice and coffee. If you're seeking fast food, you'll find Carl's Jr., McDonald's, Wendy's and Burger King southwest on Sherman (the first major intersection to the south). As somebody else noted, there's a CVS pharmacy conveniently located right next door. Entertainment: There's an Albertson's on Saticoy (the first major intersection to the north), where you can rent Redbox DVDs, or, if you're not up for the drive, there's a small mom and pop shop across the street that will also let you rent DVDs, even if you're from out of state and just visiting (credit card or cash deposit required). Overall, this is the best value you'll find in the Los Angeles area. It's completely worth the drive. My personal thanks to the other reviewers here, whose reviews prompted to me to book the room in the first place. I was going to post some photos, but honestly, the ones that are posted -- like the reviews -- are entirely reflective of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Yourself Here”
Reviews.Author: vinny700
Reviews.Content: If you absolutely need to stay here and don't have children with you, then stay here. I was told by entertainment.com that this was a decent area. When I showed up, it looked like a real dive and it seemed to have people living in here full time (and they looked pretty shady). The front parking lot is accessible, while the back parking lot is blocked by an automatic gate which will open by your room card (why in the world do you need a key to the parking lot if it is a "good area"?) To sum up my review I will write verbatim the photo I took of the sign posted by the LAPD on the building in the back parking lot: <<NO Drugs, Drug Dealers, Trespassing, Weapons, Alcoholic Beverages: The Los Angeles Police Department Makes Regular and Frequent Patrols on these Premises>> The message is repeated in Spanish right below the English on this sign. Why would the LAPD need to make frequent and regular patrols of the premises when the only people who have access to this particular area are guests of the hotel with their room card? Like I said, there are full time residents residing in this place that look pretty shady, so I see a direct correlation between this sign and the full time guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: we_be_d_travelers
Reviews.Content: What a great experience, from the moment we arrived! The staff was very pleasant and made our stay very comfortable. The rooms are newly renovated, and the two-room suite was perfect for the four adults in our party. It was a great deal for the price and a convenient location. We will definitely stay again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “clean and new!”
Reviews.Author: EddyKnots
Reviews.Content: My room was on the bottom floor. The room was clean and everything looks modern and great but there was an odd sound comming from the door or ceiling that was going on all night long for the two nights I stayed there and it was very annoying. It sounded like a really old house that makes those sorts of creeking and popping sounds. I will not be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!! Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: traveltxgirls
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Price and comfort! It is newly remodeled. Beds are good, Shower has large shower head with good water pressure. Flat Screen TV is super nice. Room is very spacious. Carpet is new, paint on walls are nice and a great sense of colors and decor. And the best thing is NO BUGS!! We paid a rate of $66.00 per night and it was great! We were close to all the attractions like, Six Flags Magic Mountain, Hollywood Blvd, Beverly Hills, Bel Air. About 15 miles to LAX airport. The area around the hotel is not hopping or exciting but if you are looking for a clean place to sleep and shower this is the place for you! It also has a refridgerator in it. Walgreens is next door, There is a grocery store about 2 blocks away, Jack in the Box and Wendy's are very close. So everything you would need is right there. Save yourself some money and stay here. Spend your money on entertainment. :) Happy Vacationing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: curtf
Reviews.Content: This property has been renovated. While not in the newest area of LA it was convenient to our location in Encino. The staff was friendlhy and helpful. Rooms clean and quiet. The common areas were not very enticing but the value was excellent and all I was looking for was a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: letterer
Reviews.Content: I needed to avoid the commute to and from Reseda for a conference. The stay was very nice. The room was beautiful and clean. The flat screen TV convenient. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: texduffer
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a pleasent surprise!! Came across this newly renovated property and we had a great experience. Rooms were very clean, spacious, new and very comfortable. Beds were fabulous. Staff very warm, met our every request. We enjoyed ourselves and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised but very pleased with service and room!”
Reviews.Author: Blonderacer
Reviews.Content: I had read the previous reviews about the Howard Johnson and was quite concerned about staying there. We went ahead and booked for one night taking a gamble. When we arrived we were greeted quite pleasantly by the staff and they were quick to help us. They told us the hotel was under construction and to let them know if there was anything we needed. We liked the secure parking and found our room easily on the second floor. Not knowing what to expect when we opened the door after reading the reviews we breathed a sigh of relief. The room was brand new!!!!!!!!!!! Everything looked great right down to the new carpet and paint. The bathroom was absolutely beautiful with all the new fixtures and granite. The room was quiet though we did hear the trash truck the next morning. We had coffee, juice, bagels and donuts for breakfast. We liked the room/hotel enough to book the next night there. The staff is quick to help with directions and suggestions. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel as well as my family. We plan to stay there again when we go back in a few months. I think the new owner is doing a great job with the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: jsanNYC
Reviews.Content: We booked a block of 20 rooms for guests attending a wedding nearby. The hotel was undergoing renovations, which they neglected to mention when reservations were made. The furnishings were falling apart (I'm not talking shabby but actually falling apart), many hair dryers, TV remotes and some telephones inoperable. Rubble in the corridors, the lobby was being painted and guests had to walk over drop cloths placed on the floor and hope they didn't get splattered by painter painting the ceiling. All in all a horrendous, not to say embarrassing, situation. Only bright spot was the staff who tried their best to handle an untenable situation.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: tyler1955
Reviews.Content: what a dump the soda had stains the chair in the room was ripped and the foam was showing. the toilet handle fell off the shower was stained the TV's had no remote the laminate on the counters were coming off as well as stained. i can go on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Update on Customer Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jJNB
Reviews.Content: I sent an e-mail to the Howard Johnson organization but I doubt it will do any real good. The reply said they were unaware of the conditions and reading between the lines, they seemed to consider this as just another "customer opinions" and to contact the motel directly.
